To foster transparency and collaboration within the software engineering community, and in support of Open Science practices, I share below my datasets and tools to facilitate replication, reuse, and verification.

::: {.dataset-item}
::: {.dataset-header}
[Experimental Package: Exploring Empathy in Software Engineering Articles](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15800354){.dataset-title}
[üìä Dataset]{.type-badge .type-dataset}

::: {.dataset-meta}
**Lidiany Cerqueira**. (Zenodo (v1.5))

::: {.dataset-note}
Contains all files, scripts, and instructions needed to replicate the data collection and analysis process for gathering and analyzing grey literature articles about empathy in software engineering from DEV.to and Medium, as well as a follow-up expert survey used to assess the resulting framework. Supplementary material of the paper "Exploring Empathy in Software Engineering: Insights from a Grey Literature Analysis of Practitioners‚Äô Perspectives" published at ACM Transactions on Software Engineering and Methodology (TOSEM). RCR Report available at [https://doi.org/10.1145/3771771](https://doi.org/10.1145/3771771).
:::
:::

::: {.dataset-item}
::: {.dataset-header}
[CERCA ‚Äì Citation Extraction & Reference Checking Assistant](https://github.com/lidianycs/cerca){.dataset-title}
[üíª Software]{.type-badge .type-software}
:::

::: {.dataset-meta}
**Lidiany Cerqueira**. ([GitHub Repository](https://github.com/lidianycs/cerca))
:::

::: {.dataset-note}
CERCA is an open-source research tool that supports verification of bibliographic references in scientific manuscripts. It extracts references from PDF files and checks their existence and consistency against authoritative metadata sources, producing explainable diagnostics, audit logs, and reproducible reports.
:::
:::

::: {.dataset-meta}
Julio C√©sar Andrade Silva, **Lidiany Cerqueira Santos**, Beatriz Silva de Santana, Glauco de Figueiredo Carneiro, Emmanuel S√°vio Silva Freire, Manoel Mendon√ßa, Jos√© Amancio Macedo Santos. (Zenodo)

::: {.dataset-note}
This dataset contains the results of a thematic analysis conducted on discussions from two Stack Exchange communities: Software Engineering and Project Management. The analysis explores developers‚Äô perceptions of productivity challenges, their impacts on well-being, and the effects on technical tasks. It is intended to support further research in software engineering, human factors, productivity studies, and qualitative analysis of practitioner discussions. It supplements the paper "Frustrating, Stressful, and Overwhelming: Insights into Software Practitioners‚Äô Productivity from Stack Exchange Discussions" published at SBES'25.
:::
:::
